attributes.action: Do not scrap A-Levels in England
attributes.additional_details: Teachers are already struggling significantly with workload. There is already a struggle to gain maths teachers who are fully qualified, alongside finding the timetable space to ensure space for 5 subjects rather than 3. Furthermore, combining a levels and t levels defeats the object of both qualifications, and forces students who do not wish to attend university into academic pathways they may not wish to go down.
attributes.background: We call on the government to block scrapping A-Levels. Teachers and students already struggle with a turbulent education system, fallen victim to constant change.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not introduce a new 'Advanced British Standard Qualification': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/647461

Do not make Mathematics and English a requirement up to 18: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/647430
